title: Can the leader in a kpop group also be the maknae? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on the company. SM generally picks the leader based on age or the length of traineeship, this means that either it is the oldest member out of the group that gets to be the leader or the one who trained the longest. For example, Red Velvet's Irene is the group's leader and its oldest member while Suho from EXO is the group's leader because he had the longest traineeship even though Xiumin is older than him. Super Junior's leader Leeteuk is also the oldest member in the group. On the other hand, YG doesn't really care for age when it comes to picking the leader. YG group leaders are picked on the basis of their ability to compose, write, produce and for their musical talents as a whole. For example, Yoon is the maknae and leader of WINNER and B.I isn't the oldest in iKON either yet he's the leader. Same goes for Big Bang G.D. So yep, it is indeed possible for a member to hold the maknae and leader title in a K-pop group but it depends on the company. I think SM is more strict & traditional when it comes to assigning roles such as centre, leader, dancer, visual and maknae etc but a company such as YG doesn't really like to label its artists that way or put them in a box.

From what I know there has never been a time when a company knowingly made the maknae the leader. However for one group this came unintentionally. That is Winner. Winner, after going through WIN:Who is next?, a surrvial program which they won over iKON, had 5 members: Seunghoon, Jinwoo, Seungyoon, Mino and Taehyun. Mino was the first leader of Winner. However, after injury, Seungyoon(the second youngest) took over as leader. However later, Taehyun left due to mental health issues and that made Seungyoon the maknae and leader of Winner. From what I know, his leadership skills are good, but people don’t talk about them as much as GD, CL, or Hanbin/B.I’s proabably because he is the maknae and age matters a lot in Korean culture. This is very unlikely to happen again, although YG is known for having leaders who are not the oldest or the most trained but the people who naturally become the leader. Like for iKON, Hanbin was never told he was the leader but it naturally evolved and I think similar cases occurred for GD and BigBang and CL and 2NE1. But still, based on the current trainees, I don’t think any maknaes can become the leader since YG has huge age gaps(The oldest trainee is a 98 liner and the youngest is an 05). And I don’t think their are many other companies who lets the leader be the person who becomes the leader, rather the oldest or the most trained.

It is possible. It is very rare though. It almost never happens but it has happened. There is a girl group were the leader is also the maknae. Her stage name is Blue and is born on January 18 1994. She is from the group Pungdeng-E who are under the company DOMA Entertainment, but they are really underrated so not many people know them. They debuted in December 2013 and they have 3 members.  Source: Pungdeng-E Members Profile (Updated!) There is also a band where the leader is the maknae. The group name is Drug Restaurant and they debuted May 27 2015. The leader is Jung Joon Young and was born on February 21, 1989 and is Leader (obviously), Main Vocalist and Rhythm Guitarist. They are also underrated so not many people know them.

A very recent instance of this happening would be PinkFantasy’s Arang. When PinkFantasy first debuted, Arang was neither the leader nor the maknae—member Aini was chosen to be the leader (possibly due to age, being born in 1991, or more than likely the fact that she had already debuted in two groups prior to PF) while Heesun, born in 2005, was four years younger Arang (the second youngest in the group, born 2001). Heesun left PF in October 2019 due to depression and anxiety, which made Arang the maknae. In April 2020, Mydoll Ent. announced that Aini would be leaving PinkFantasy due to plantar fascilitis (feet problems) and left the leader position open. In Mydoll’s statement regarding Aini, they said the following: “[Arang] has been chosen as the member of PinkFantasy to succeed Aini as leader. Arang may be the youngest member of the team, but not only has she been with us since the beginning, but we have decided there will be no shortage of responsibility and trust from the members with Arang as leader.” (translation: ppaliwabwaa on twitter) So, even though it seems almost unthinkable, Arang became the maknae and the leader!

It certainly can happen but usually the maknae is very babied and rather spoiled and is expected to be kind and obedient to his hyungs. So it would be hard for a maknae to be the one telling the others what to do. But there's exceptions to that rule of course. The one that comes to mind although he is technically not the maknae but he's younger than every other group member is Zico. He's second youngest and the leader of Block B. Given his personality and the other group members personalities it worked out well for them. We will just have to wait and see if any group comes out and the maknae is the leader! That'll be fun to watch!

Well it's kinda rare but as far as I know, There is one duo known as JUS2 (Sub unit Of GOT7 under JYPE) Where the group's giant maknae KIM YUGYEOM is the leader of JUS2 JUS2 is a duo with JB (GOT7'S LEADER) and KIM YUGYEOM (GOT7'S maknae)..so the leader of JUS2 is…  yugyeom who is apparently a maknae😊 Listen to their debut song 'FOCUS ON ME' it's a BOP✌️ I think the question was about a kpop group 😅and I've written about a duo…But it's fine as long as it is more than a single member😊✌️

The only one I can think of is Winner’s Seungyoon. And he actually wasn’t initially the maknae of the group, Nam Tae-hyun was, but he left the group not long after debut. As far as I know, Leadership has seniority over age so he does in fact lead the group and the members do treat and respect him as the leader.

There’s a special case in TTS - a SNSD unit. Taeyeon said that Seohyun (who is the maknae of SNSD) acted as the leader when they were promoting as TTS and Tiffany said that it was because she’s been following them for years so it was “Seohyun’s time now”. That was pretty interesting because Taeyeon’s the leader of SNSD so people assumed she’d lead them. So yeah, I guess a maknae could lead if they have the respect of the members and enough knowledge.

(This is the only one I can remember at the top of my head >-<) 2NE1’s CL CL is the leader and Minzy is actually the maknae of the group. But then she left before the disbandment, making CL the youngest for a little while because Dara and Bom are both 84′ liners.

The only group I remember having a maknae leader was Playback. They originally debuted as a four member girl group, and Woolim was their maknae and leader at the time. After a year or two they added a new member Ma Eunjin (those who watched Produce 101 s1 might remember her as the late addition to Doyeon’s Lachata group, but had to leave the show due to health reasons) who is now the maknae of the group.
